title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating a similarity between the land survey methods shown in the two images.

Two points for describing how a similarity between the land survey methods resulted in the spatial patterns shown in Image 1 and Image 2.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following similarities between the land survey methods that resulted in the spatial patterns shown in Image 1 and Image 2:
The response correctly describes one of the following similarities between the land survey methods that resulted in the spatial patterns shown in Image 1 and Image 2:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating a disadvantage of the land survey method used in the St. Lawrence River valley.

Two points for describing why one or more characteristics or results of the land survey method used in the St. Lawrence River valley may be disadvantageous.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the land use patterns shown in Image 2 produce a unique cultural landscape and/or contribute to the feelings, perceptions, and attitudes associated with a sense of place.

Two points for explaining the process by which the land use patterns shown in Image 2 produce a unique cultural landscape and/or contribute to the feelings, perceptions, and attitudes associated with a sense of place.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the land use patterns shown in Image 2 may create a sense of place in contemporary rural communities:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the land use patterns shown in Image 2 may create a sense of place in contemporary rural communities:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that agricultural practices in Oxfordshire may become more sustainable.

Two points for explaining one of more specific ways in which a growing demand for organic products in Oxfordshire may affect agricultural practices in this area.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that a growing demand for organic products in Oxfordshire may affect agricultural practices in this area:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that remotely sensed images show an aerial view of spatial patterns.

Two points for explaining one or more specific kinds of rural landscape analysis that can be performed using remote sensing.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why remotely sensed images are useful for rural landscape analysis:
